page.title: 14Longridge Fell - Fauna
page.content:
Ducks and roosting gulls visit the area. Only a few waders appear except sandpipers. Curlew, Redshank, snipe and lapwing breed in the area, and breeding species of fellside and woodland include meadow pippit, skylark, linnet, kestrel, carion crow, whinchat, goldcrest, tawny own, chaffinch, song thrush, mistle thrush, blackbird, dunnock, robbin, grey wagtail, pied wagtail, bullfinch, redpoll, cuckoo, willow warbler and blackcap. Short-eared owl, hen harrier, redwing and fieldfare appear as winter visitors.
Lepidoptera include cabbage white, small copper, green hairstreak, small heath, red admiral, peacock, meadow brown. The moths of note include emperor, northern eggar and elephant hawk-moth.
